tier1Capital.title: Tier 1 Capital (CET1 + Additional Tier 1)
tier1Capital.description: Core capital that absorbs losses without the bank being required to cease trading. Must be at least 6% of risk-weighted assets for UCBs.

commonEquityTier1.title: Common Equity Tier 1 (CET1)
commonEquityTier1.description: Highest quality capital, primary loss absorber

components.name: Surplus
components.description: Balance in profit and loss account

components.name: Disclosed Reserves
components.description: General reserves disclosed in balance sheet

deductions: Deferred tax assets arising from temporary differences
Deferred tax assets arising from unused tax losses
Direct and indirect holdings in financial institutions
Other amounts as may be specified by RBI

additionalTier1.title: Additional Tier 1 (AT1) Capital
additionalTier1.description: Supplementary core capital instruments that can absorb losses

components.name: Innovative Perpetual Instruments
components.description: Perpetual debt instruments with loss absorption

requirements: Loss absorption at point of non-viability
additionalTier1.ucbContext: Limited usage in UCBs, primarily CET1

tier2Capital.title: Tier 2 Capital (Supplementary Capital)
tier2Capital.description: Supplementary capital that provides loss absorption capability after Tier 1 capital is depleted. Cannot exceed 100% of Tier 1 capital (50% for Tier 2 and below UCBs).

components.name: Revaluation Reserves
components.description: Reserves from revaluation of assets (included in Tier 2 if not in CET1)

components.name: General Provisions
components.description: General provisions and loss reserves not against specific identified impairment

components.name: Hybrid Instruments
components.description: Debt capital instruments with equity characteristics

components.name: Subordinated Debt
components.description: Unsecured debt that ranks below other debts
components.limits: Minimum 5 year original maturity, amortized in last 5 years

components.name: Perpetual Cumulative Preference Shares
components.description: Perpetual preference shares with cumulative dividend

requirements: Minimum 5 year original maturity for debt instruments
Amortization of principal in last 5 years
Subordination to depositors and general creditors

deductions.title: Deductions from Capital
deductions.description: Items that must be deducted primarily from Tier 1 capital (CET1).

fromCET1.description: Intangible assets other than goodwill (mortgage servicing rights, etc.)
DTA arising from unused tax losses
Bank's investments in its own capital instruments
Cross holdings of capital instruments of financial institutions
Direct holdings in capital instruments of banking/financial entities
Indirect holdings through investments in subsidiaries
Other amounts specified by RBI from time to time

ucbNotes: UCBs with limited investments may have minimal deductions
Goodwill from amalgamation requires full deduction
Software development costs may be intangible requiring deduction

capitalConservationBuffer.title: Capital Conservation Buffer (CCB)
capitalConservationBuffer.description: Additional capital to be built outside minimum requirements

countercyclicalBuffer.title: Countercyclical Capital Buffer (CCyB)
countercyclicalBuffer.description: Buffer activated during periods of high credit growth

systemicallyImportantBuffer.title: Systemically Important Bank (SIB) Buffer
systemicallyImportantBuffer.description: Additional capital for systemically important UCBs

creditRisk.formula: Credit RWA = Sum of (Risk Weight × Exposure) for all exposures

marketRisk.formula: Market RWA = 12.5 × Market Risk Capital Charge

total.formula: Total RWA = Credit RWA + Market RWA + Operational RWA

tier2Limit.general: Tier 2 capital cannot exceed 100% of Tier 1 capital
tier2Limit.tier2AndBelowUCBs: Tier 2 capital cannot exceed 50% of Tier 1 capital

generalProvisions.applicability: General provisions not against specific impairment

notes.treatment: Not eligible for Tier 1 capital as it is held with RBI
May be treated as capital if certain conditions met
55% discount applied for inclusion in capital
Intangible assets requiring deduction from capital
Can impact capital ratios; requires monitoring

metadata.source: UCB Guidelines by RBI - Comprehensive Compilation (December 2025)
